page.title: 05HIGH CROSS VILLAGE.
page.content: The village of High Cross stands on the A.10 London to Cambridge road. It is a linear settlement where two small lanes make a crossroads with the A.10. The village shop is also the post office and sells a great variety of goods. Near the shop is the village hall,where many activities are organised (eg. there was an evening class on clog dancing in June). On the A.10 is "The White Horse" pub,which has attractive,white weather-boarding. There are 2 petrol stations in the village,which serve the busy A.10. The only industries are a horse-box makers who started in 1957 and employ 42 people,a woodcraft firm who also frame pictures and a small yard which sells paving slabs. The housing is of mixed age. Along the A.10 there are pretty C18th terraced cottages,but the rest are modern semis and detached houses.
